rationales.conformity: He accepts the lead track partly because team and partner expectations make refusal feel socially costly.
rationales.self_direction: He recognizes the role may not fit his preferred way of working but commits anyway.
rationales.achievement: Taking the promotion path reflects pursuit of recognized professional success.

rationales.benevolence: He gives most of his week to onboarding a new hire so she can ramp faster.

rationales.conformity: He withholds a redesign idea in front of senior architects to avoid appearing disruptive.
rationales.self_direction: He suppresses his own technical judgment even though he has a concrete alternative.
He is strongly drawn to building an unsanctioned tool because it matches how he wants to work.
rationales.conformity: He hesitates because he is being evaluated for lead and worries about permission and optics.

rationales.self_direction: He decides to help Pieter and starts building the API on his own initiative after hours.
rationales.stimulation: He feels more energized by this novel side build than by routine sprint work.

rationales.conformity: He gives the expected promotion-track narrative and withholds how much the side project matters.
rationales.self_direction: He avoids openly naming the path that actually lights him up.
rationales.achievement: He values being on a trajectory that signals success to people close to him.
He commits to putting his best foot forward after being officially shortlisted for tech lead.
rationales.conformity: He keeps doubts private and maintains the expected professional posture.

rationales.achievement: He explicitly values the lead role's better pay and visibility.
rationales.conformity: He keeps presenting the promotion path as straightforward in social settings.
rationales.self_direction: He continues investing attention in Pieter's repo because it aligns with his intrinsic interests.
He immediately says yes to bringing the deployment tool into the official roadmap.
rationales.achievement: He takes a high-visibility opportunity by presenting upward and formalizing the project.

rationales.conformity: He defaults to a smooth, non-confrontational response with Martijn to avoid looking difficult.
rationales.self_direction: He does not assert his autonomy even though he knows he is delivering on commitments.

rationales.achievement: He accepts the tech lead offer immediately, advancing to a higher-status role.
rationales.conformity: He frames acceptance as automatic because that is what people expect him to do.
rationales.self_direction: He bypasses reflection on fit and personal preference in the decision moment.

rationales.conformity: He treats broad external approval as confirmation that his decision was correct.
rationales.self_direction: His dominant feeling is relief from meeting expectations rather than ownership of his own choice.
